item.title: Getting Started with Regression: An Introductory Guide (Part 1)
item.author: Han
item.description: Getting Started with Regression: An Introductory Guide (Part 1) Regression is a method used to identify the relationship between input and output variables. In a regression problem, we are given a set of noisy measurements (or output data) $\mathbf{y} = [y_1, \dots, y_d]^T$, which are affected by measurement noise $\boldsymbol{\eta} = [\eta_1, \dots, \eta_d]^T$. The corresponding input data is denoted by $\mathbf{x} = [x_1, \dots, x_d]$. We refer to the collection of these input-output pairs as the training data, $\mathcal{D} = {(\mathbf{x}_1, \mathbf{y}_1), \dots, (\mathbf{x}_m, \mathbf{y}_m)}$.
